passages.text: Citi Research is a division of Citigroup Global Markets Inc. (the "Firm"), which does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the Firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. Certain products (not inconsistent with the author's published research) are available only on Citi's portals.

We are discontinuing coverage of 29Metals (29M). The firm's current and last recommendation for the Company is Sell/High Risk and our target price is \(0.16. This is our last rating on 29M; we will not provide updates to our previous research or ratings. You should not rely on this or previous research with respect to this company going forward.

We are discontinuing coverage of Sims Ltd (SGM). The firm's current and last recommendation for the Company is Neutral and our target price is \(14.00. This is our last rating on SGM; we will not provide updates to our previous research or ratings. You should not rely on this or previous research with respect to this company going forward.

We are discontinuing coverage of New Hope Corporation Ltd (NHC). The firm's current and last recommendation for the Company is Neutral and our target price is \(4.25. This is our last rating on NHC; we will not provide updates to our previous research or ratings. You should not rely on this or previous research with respect to this company going forward.

We are discontinuing coverage of Stanmore Resources Ltd (SMR). The firm's current and last recommendation for the Company is Buy and our target price is \(3.00. This is our last rating on SMR; we will not provide updates to our previous research or ratings. You should not rely on this or previous research with respect to this company going forward.

Price: $1.91; TP: $3.00; # Shares: 90Tm; Market Cap: A$172Zm; Recommend: Buy

We rate 29M as Sell/High Risk based on valuation, but acknowledge a scarcity of ASX- listed copper producers. Compared to the IPO, production outcomes have varied vs expectations, and both sites have experienced operational headwinds and struggled to generate free cash. Capricorn Copper is in care and maintenance following continued water events post substantial flood damage in 1Q23; coupled with tailings constraints. There is no clear path on a future for the asset or funding pathway to do so. On our base case assumptions, 29M would require more funding via equity in CY28.

We set our target price for 29M at \(0.16 / sh\) . We value 29M on \(1.0x\) P/NAV and forward \(3x\) EV/EBITDA in line with peers and reflecting the status of Capricorn Copper. For reference, we also derive a sum- of- the- parts NAV by applying a nominal WACC of \(7.5\%\) to discounted cash flows over the life of the group's individual assets. We apply a \(60\%\) risk discount to Capricorn Copper. We value Redhill at an in- ground resource value only, given the early- stage nature. Our long- term assumptions include US \(4.54 / lb\) for copper, US \(1.22 / lb\) for zinc, US \(2,300 / oz\) for gold, and an AUDUSD exchange rate of 0.75. Our DCF valuation is net of cash and overhead costs, and includes exploration potential and resources ex- reserves.

We rate 29M as High Risk given our forecast of cash burn in FY25 and very limited balance sheet headroom, potential delays to Capricorn Copper's restart/execution risk and recent downgrades at the Golden Grove mine in WA.

The key risks to our investment thesis and target price on 29M include balance sheet risk, commodity exposure and mining, geotechnical and geological conditions. We also assume 29M can access additional funding via equity. A private equity company also holds \(\sim 45\%\) of the register with their shares no longer in escrow. If economic conditions weaken, 29M's pricing and sales volumes could be limited and impair the company's earnings power. Conversely, stronger- than- expected demand could cause the shares to exceed our target price. Mining operations can be subject to delays and resequencing due to geology and mining issues. Any production problems could reduce 29M's profitability, investor confidence and the company's share price.
If the impact on the company from any of these factors proves to be greater or less than we anticipate, the stock will either outperform or underperform our target price.

We rate New Hope (NHC) Neutral on valuation grounds. With \(80\%\) interest in flagship Bengalla Joint Venture, NHC has established itself as a mature coal mine operator with tier 1 cash cost positioning to support through the cycle margins.

We derive our rounded target price of \(A\) 4.25 from a \(50\%\) weighting of discounted NPV (adjusted for dividend) and a \(50\%\) weighted \(4.5x\) FY27 EV/EBITDA multiple. Our NHC base valuation is based on DCF analysis using a \(7.5\%\) real, after- tax, unlevered discount rate. Our long- term assumptions include US \(100 / t\) for thermal coal and AUDUSD exchange rate of 0.75.

We see the following upside risks to achieving our forecasts and target price for NHC: (1) Mine life extensions beyond 2039 at Bengalla and at New Acland with expanded coal resource/reserves; (2) Australian dollar thermal coal price upside.

The downside risks to achieving our target price include: (1) Australian dollar thermal coal price downside; (2) Sustainable capex at Bengalla proves to be higher than anticipated (dragline and extensive fleet).

We rate SGM Neutral on valuation grounds. A five- year self- help strategy that shifted the company's focus from hard dollar targets to ROIC hurdles has successfully transformed the business into a more profitable operation. While we expect SGM's well- invested NAM and Australian operations to provide relatively stable profits in the long run, near- term earnings may come under pressure. Growth aspirations may restrict dividend payments into a weaker scrap price environment.

Our rounded target price of \(A\) 14.0 is based on a blend of PE Relative, SOTP valuations and DCF. Our PE Relative valuation is based on mid- cycle FY27e EPS capitalised at a multiple of c13x (weighted ASX200 Non- Bank Industrials PE and ASX200 Resources PE), which balances earnings operating leverage created by management vs. the company's undeniable commodity exposure. Sum- of- the- parts (SOTP) valuation is divisional EBITDA averaged over four years of history and four years of forecast period (to capture a typical economic cycle) then EBITDA multiples applied to each division based on assessment of risk and demonstration of controllable cost reduction. DCF valuation is based on WACC (real) of \(8.4\%\) (beta of 1.2, equity risk premium of \(7.5\%\) , risk- free rate of \(5.0\%\) ) and a terminal growth rate of \(1.0\%\) .

SGM remains a highly cyclical business with exposure to volatile ferrous and non- ferrous commodity prices and volumes. Key downside risks to achieving our target price include: (1) general economic activity with Australia, North America, and the UK impacting the demand for, and supply flow, of scrap

metal with particular sensitivity to any further fall in annual volumes; (2) currency - any appreciation of the \(\) A\$ results in an adverse impact on EBIT on the translation of earnings from the North American and European business; and (3) balance sheet risk due to insufficient cash flow generation, large trading losses eroding cash, or the material write- down of operating assets. The opposite of these factors could mean upside risk that could sustain the shares above our target price.

We are Buy- rated on valuation grounds. SMR is a play on our constructive view of the metallurgical coal market as a seaborn market deficit should support higher prices for longer. We believe coking coal restocking should emerge following the recent price collapse, supporting prices over 2Q- 3Q, while the 4Q- 1Q outlook also looks constructive on heightened weather disruption risk from a potential shift to La Nina. Following the temporary slowdown, economic activities in India should recover and pre- monsoon restocking should also support imports.

We generated a rounded price target of \(\) 3.0\(using a 50\%\) weighted dividend adjusted DCF and 50% weighted FY27e EV/EBITDA valuation using a 2.5x multiple. We assume a WACC of 7.5%, LT real HCC price of US\) \ \(200\) /tonne and FOB cash costs averaging marginally below US \(100/t\) this decade. We model based on the latest guided mine plan projections. Our low 2.5x EV/EBITDA multiple reflects SMR's relatively short mine life. The potential for extending mine life and increasing reserves could unlock substantial value, but regulatory permitting, geological and coal pricing remain risks.
We see the following downside risks to achieving our TP:

- A more bearish coking coal price scenario assuming persistent weakness in the China steel market and weaker than anticipated steel demand growth from India.- Spot AUD strengthening against USD.- Failure to ramp-up South Walker Creek to 7mtpa saleable coal production and/or current production rates at PoiTrel, Isaac Plains Complex and Mavis Downs.- Higher-than-expected operating costs and SIB capex levels.- Regulatory risk with operations subject to mining lease extension by Australian state/federal regulators.- Not being able to refinance the existing acquisition facility at lower rates.

Upside risks that would cause the share price to exceed our TP: - A more bullish coking coal price scenario from the China steel market rebounding strongly from recent government stimulus coupled with an uptick in Indian steel demand growth.- Spot USD strengthening against AUD.- Ramp-up of South Walker Creek beyond 7mtpa saleable coal production and/or current production rates at PoiTrel, Isaac Plains Complex and Mavis

- Operational efficiencies and variable inputs costs achieving a lower-than-expected operating costs and SIB capex levels.- Extending mine life and/or increasing reserves.- Successfully advancing work on the Eagle Downs resource base to make it a viable project

(For an explanation of the determination of significant financial interest, please refer to the policy for managing conflicts of interest which can be found at www.citiVelocity.com.)

Analysts' compensation is determined by Citi Research management and Citigroup's senior management and is based upon activities and services intended to benefit the investor clients of Citigroup Global Markets Inc. and its affiliates (the "Firm"). Compensation is not linked to specific transactions or recommendations. Like all Firm employees, analysts receive compensation that is impacted by overall Firm profitability which includes investment banking, sales and trading, and principal trading revenues. One factor in equity research analyst compensation is arranging corporate access events between institutional clients and the management teams of covered companies. Typically, company management is more likely to participate when the analyst has a positive view of the company.

For financial instruments recommended in the Product in which the Firm is not a market maker, the Firm is a liquidity provider in such financial instruments (and any underlying instruments) and may act as principal in connection with transactions in such instruments. The Firm is a regular issuer of traded financial instruments linked to securities that may have been recommended in the Product. The Firm regularly trades in the securities of the issuer(s) discussed in the Product. The Firm may engage in securities transactions in a manner inconsistent with the Product and, with respect to securities covered by the Product, will buy or sell from customers on a principal basis.

Unless stated otherwise neither the Research Analyst nor any member of their team has viewed the material operations of the Companies for which an investment view has been provided within the past 12 months.

For important disclosures (including copies of historical disclosures) regarding the companies that are the subject of this Citi Research product ("the Product"), please contact Citi Research, 388 Greenwich Street, 6th Floor, New York, NY, 10013, Attention: Legal/Compliance [E6WYB6412478]. In addition, the same important disclosures, with the exception of the Valuation and Risk assessments and historical disclosures, are contained on the Firm's disclosure website at

https://www.citivelocity.com/cvr/ppublic/citi_research_disclosures. Valuation and Risk assessments can be found in the text of the most recent research note/report regarding the subject company. Pursuant to the Market Abuse Regulation a history of all Citi Research recommendations published during the preceding 12- month period can be accessed via Citi Velocity (https://www.citivelocity.com/cv2) or your standard distribution portal. Historical disclosures (for up to the past three years) will be provided upon request.

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks. Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus

the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of \(15\%\) or more or \(25\%\) or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "-" and "-" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re- establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short- term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds \(15\%\) against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.

The proportion of all Citi Research research recommendations that were the equivalent to "Buy", "Hold", "Sell" at the end of each quarter over the prior 12 months (with the % of these that had received investment firm services from Citi in the prior 12 months shown in brackets) is as follows: Q2 2025 Buy \(33\%\) (63%), Hold \(44\%\) (51%), Sell \(23\%\) (49%), RV \(0.4\%\) (86%); Q1 2025 Buy \(33\%\) (63%), Hold \(44\%\) (51%), Sell \(23\%\) (49%), RV \(0.5\%\) (87%); Q4 2024 Buy \(32\%\) (64%), Hold \(44\%\) (52%), Sell \(23\%\) (44%), RV \(0.4\%\) (92%); Q3 2024 Buy \(33\%\) (61%), Hold \(44\%\) (52%), Sell \(23\%\) (49%), RV \(0.4\%\) (80%). For the purposes of disclosing recommendations other than for equity (whose definitions can be found in the corresponding disclosure sections), "Buy"
means a positive directional trade idea; "Sell" means a negative directional trade idea; and "Relative Value" means any trade idea which does not have a clear direction to the investment strategy.

Citi Research broadly and simultaneously disseminates its research content to the Firm's institutional and retail clients via the Firm's proprietary electronic distribution platforms (e.g., Citi Velocity and various Global Wealth platforms). Citi Research may provide different research products and services to different classes of customers (for example, based upon long- term or short- term investment horizons) that may lead to differing conclusions or recommendations that could impact the price of a security contrary to the recommendations in the alternative research product, provided that each is consistent with the rating system for each respective product.
